title: AGENTS.md
text: gsDesignTune prioritizes user experience, reproducibility, auditability systematic design-space exploration group sequential designs {gsDesign}. Keep changes small, explicit, easy review.

title: AGENTS.md
text: R/: package code (R6 classes, tune specs, execution engine, metrics). inst/report/: HTML report template used GSDTuneJob$report(). vignettes/: end--end examples; render without manual steps beyond devtools::load_all(). tests/testthat/: testthat edition 3 + snapshots. vendor/: upstream sources reference ; never modify; excluded builds via .Rbuildignore.

title: AGENTS.md
text: Load locally: devtools::load_all(".") Regenerate docs/NAMESPACE: roxygen2::roxygenise() Run tests: devtools::test() Render vignette (important): devtools::load_all("."); rmarkdown::render("vignettes/<name>.Rmd")

title: AGENTS.md
text: global parallel plan: never call future::plan() inside package code; respect user’s plan. Parallelization via future.apply::future_lapply() {progressr}. Never drop failures: configuration must recorded status, error_message, warnings. Failed configs stay results table. Audit trail: keep job$spec complete (base args, tuned args, strategy, timestamps, sessionInfo()), keep call_args reconstructable configuration. Vector args atomic: treat vector-valued arguments (e.g., timing, gamma, R) single setting; use tune_values(list(...)), element-wise expansion. Dependencies explicit: express dependencies using tune_dep() (general) SpendingSpec/SpendingFamily (preferred spending functions). Dependency graphs must acyclic.

title: AGENTS.md
text: Keep non-scalar values list-columns; simplify true scalar atomic columns. Prefer helpers already codebase (e.g., list-column simplification labeling). careful function-valued columns: printing/plotting must break column contains functions (see toString.function plot-time labeling helpers). report templates (inst/report/*.Rmd), qualify common functions (utils::str, utils::head, etc.) rendering uses minimal environment. Don’t add new dependencies casually. new package needed UX correctness, ask first.

title: AGENTS.md
text: Update roxygen docs re-run roxygen2::roxygenise() (regenerates NAMESPACE man/). Update _pkgdown.yml reference sections match exports. Add concise entry NEWS.md (relevant) update README.md examples. Add/adjust tests (prefer focused unit tests + one snapshot key metrics).

title: Getting started: tuning gsDesign()
code: if (requireNamespace("ggplot2", quietly = TRUE)) {   job$plot(metric = "final_n", x = "upper_par", color = "upper_fun") } #> Warning: `aes_string()` was deprecated in ggplot2 3.0.0. #> ℹ Please use tidy evaluation idioms with `aes()`. #> ℹ See also `vignette("ggplot2-in-packages")` for more information. #> ℹ The deprecated feature was likely used in the gsDesignTune package. #>   Please report the issue at #>   <https://github.com/nanxstats/gsDesignTune/issues>. #> This warning is displayed once per session. #> Call `lifecycle::last_lifecycle_warnings()` to see where this warning was #> generated.

title: Getting started: tuning gsSurv()
code: job <- gsSurvTune(   k = 3,   test.type = 4,   alpha = 0.025,   beta = 0.10,   timing = tune_values(list(c(0.33, 0.67, 1), c(0.5, 0.75, 1))),   hr = tune_seq(0.60, 0.75, length_out = 3),   upper = SpendingFamily$new(     SpendingSpec$new(sfLDOF, par = tune_fixed(0)),     SpendingSpec$new(sfHSD, par = tune_seq(-4, 4, length_out = 3))   ),   lower = SpendingSpec$new(sfLDOF, par = tune_fixed(0)),   lambdaC = log(2) / 6,   eta = 0.01,   gamma = c(2.5, 5, 7.5, 10),   R = c(2, 2, 2, 6),   T = 18,   minfup = 6,   ratio = 1 )  job$run(strategy = "grid", parallel = FALSE) res <- job$results() head(res) #>   upper_setting lower_setting       timing    hr upper_fun upper_par lower_fun #> 1  function....  function.... 0.33, 0..... 0.600    sfLDOF         0    sfLDOF #> 2 title: Getting started: tuning gsSurv()
text: gsSurvCalendarTune() similar gsSurvTune(), specify planned calendar times analyses via calendarTime instead information timing.
code: job_cal <- gsSurvCalendarTune(   test.type = 4,   alpha = 0.025,   beta = 0.10,   calendarTime = tune_values(list(c(12, 24, 36), c(9, 18, 27))),   spending = tune_choice("information", "calendar"),   hr = tune_seq(0.60, 0.75, length_out = 3),   upper = SpendingFamily$new(     SpendingSpec$new(sfLDOF, par = tune_fixed(0)),     SpendingSpec$new(sfHSD, par = tune_seq(-4, 4, length_out = 3))   ),   lower = SpendingSpec$new(sfLDOF, par = tune_fixed(0)),   lambdaC = log(2) / 6,   eta = 0.01,   gamma = c(2.5, 5, 7.5, 10),   R = c(2, 2, 2, 6),   minfup = 18,   ratio = 1 ) title: Parallel execution with future + reproducible reporting
code: plan(multisession, workers = 2)  job <- gsSurvTune(   k = 3,   test.type = 4,   alpha = 0.025,   beta = 0.10,   timing = tune_values(list(c(0.33, 0.67, 1), c(0.5, 0.75, 1))),   hr = tune_seq(0.60, 0.75, length_out = 5),   upper = SpendingFamily$new(     SpendingSpec$new(sfLDOF, par = tune_fixed(0)),     SpendingSpec$new(sfHSD, par = tune_seq(-4, 4, length_out = 5))   ),   lower = SpendingSpec$new(sfLDOF, par = tune_fixed(0)),   lambdaC = log(2) / 6,   eta = 0.01,   gamma = c(2.5, 5, 7.5, 10),   R = c(2, 2, 2, 6),   T = 18,   minfup = 6,   ratio = 1 )  job$run(strategy = "grid", parallel = TRUE, seed = 1, cache_dir = "gstune_cache")

title: Parallel execution with future + reproducible reporting
Parallel execution with future + reproducible reporting
Spending functions and dependent parameters
code: job1 <- gsSurvTune(   k = 3,   test.type = 4,   alpha = 0.025,   beta = 0.10,   timing = c(0.33, 0.67, 1),   hr = tune_values(list(0.65, 0.70)),   upper = SpendingFamily$new(     SpendingSpec$new(sfLDOF, par = tune_fixed(0)),     SpendingSpec$new(sfHSD, par = tune_seq(-4, 4, length_out = 3))   ),   lower = SpendingSpec$new(sfLDOF, par = tune_fixed(0)),   lambdaC = log(2) / 6,   eta = 0.01,   gamma = c(2.5, 5, 7.5, 10),   R = c(2, 2, 2, 6),   T = 18,   minfup = 6,   ratio = 1 )  job1$run(strategy = "grid", parallel = FALSE) res1 <- job1$results() head(res1[, c("hr", "upper_fun", "upper_par", "final_events")]) #>     hr upper_fun upper_par final_events #> 1 0.65    sfLDOF         0     239.6915 #> 2 0.70    sfLDOF         0     349.7268 #> 3 0.65     sfHSD        -4     240.4291 #> 4 0.70     sfHSD        -4     350.8029 #> 5 0.65     sfHSD         0     260.3331 #> 6 0.70     sfHSD         0     379.8442

title: Spending functions and dependent parameters
code: job2 <- gsSurvTune(   k = 3,   test.type = 4,   alpha = 0.025,   beta = 0.10,   timing = c(0.33, 0.67, 1),   hr = tune_values(list(0.65, 0.70)),   sfu = tune_choice(sfLDOF, sfHSD),   sfupar = tune_dep(     depends_on = "sfu",     map = function(sfu) {       if (identical(sfu, sfLDOF)) tune_fixed(0) else tune_seq(-4, 4, length_out = 3)     }   ),   sfl = sfLDOF,   sflpar = 0,   lambdaC = log(2) / 6,   eta = 0.01,   gamma = c(2.5, 5, 7.5, 10),   R = c(2, 2, 2, 6),   T = 18,   minfup = 6,   ratio = 1 )  job2$run(strategy = "grid", parallel = FALSE) res2 <- job2$results() head(res2[, c("hr", "sfu", "sfupar", "final_events")]) #>     hr              sfu sfupar final_events #> 1 0.65 gsDesign::sfLDOF      0     239.6915 #> 2 0.65  gsDesign::sfHSD     -4     240.4291 #> 3 0.65  gsDesign::sfHSD      0     260.3331 #> 4 0.65  gsDesign::sfHSD      4     317.9218 #> 5 0.70 gsDesign::sfLDOF      0     349.7268 #> 6 0.70  gsDesign::sfHSD     -4     350.8029 if (requireNamespace("ggplot2", quietly = TRUE)) {   job2$plot(metric = "final_events", x = "hr", color = "sfu") } #> Warning: `aes_string()` was deprecated in ggplot2 3.0.0. #> ℹ Please use tidy evaluation idioms with `aes()`. #> ℹ See also `vignette("ggplot2-in-packages")` for more information. #> ℹ The deprecated feature was likely used in the gsDesignTune package. #>   Please report the issue at #>   <https://github.com/nanxstats/gsDesignTune/issues>. #> This warning is displayed once per session. #> Call `lifecycle::last_lifecycle_warnings()` to see where this warning was #> generated.

what: Dependency-Aware Scenario Exploration for Group Sequential Designs
title: Dependency-Aware Scenario Exploration for Group Sequential Designs
text: gsDesignTune enables systematic, dependency-aware scenario exploration group sequential designs created gsDesign. built design-space evaluation (ranking, filtering, Pareto trade-offs) rather claiming single “optimal design”. Focusing user experience, correctness, speed, supports --shelf parallel processing progress tracking, caching, reproducible reporting.

title: Dependency-Aware Scenario Exploration for Group Sequential Designs
text: can install development version gsDesignTune GitHub :

title: Dependency-Aware Scenario Exploration for Group Sequential Designs
text: Drop-workflow: replace gsDesign()/gsSurv()/gsSurvCalendar() gsDesignTune()/gsSurvTune()/gsSurvCalendarTune(), $run(). Dependency-aware tuning: express relationships like spending function ↔︎ spending parameter. Grid random search candidate sets (vector-valued args treated atomically). Parallel evaluation via {future} / {future.apply} progress via {progressr} (global plan set). Reproducible auditable results: per-config warnings/errors + reconstructable underlying call. Optional caching design objects disk HTML reporting via {rmarkdown}.

title: Dependency-Aware Scenario Exploration for Group Sequential Designs
text: Evaluate time--event designs:
code: library(gsDesign) library(gsDesignTune) library(future)  plan(multisession, workers = 2)  job <- gsSurvTune(   k = 3,   test.type = 4,   alpha = 0.025,   beta = 0.10,   timing = tune_values(list(c(0.33, 0.67, 1), c(0.5, 0.75, 1))),   hr = tune_seq(0.55, 0.75, length_out = 5),   upper = SpendingFamily$new(     SpendingSpec$new(sfLDOF, par = tune_fixed(0)),     SpendingSpec$new(sfHSD, par = tune_seq(-4, 4, length_out = 9))   ),   lower = SpendingSpec$new(sfLDOF, par = tune_fixed(0)),   lambdaC = log(2) / 6,   eta = 0.01,   gamma = c(2.5, 5, 7.5, 10),   R = c(2, 2, 2, 6),   T = 18,   minfup = 6,   ratio = 1 )  job$run(strategy = "grid", parallel = TRUE, seed = 1, cache_dir = "gstune_cache")  res <- job$results() head(res)  job$best("final_events", direction = "min") job$pareto(metrics = c("final_events", "upper_z1"), directions = c("min", "min"))  job$plot(metric = "final_events", x = "hr", color = "upper_fun") job$report("gstune_report.html")

title: Dependency-Aware Scenario Exploration for Group Sequential Designs
text: tune_fixed(x): explicit fixed value (useful inside dependencies) tune_values(list(...)): explicit candidates (supports vector-valued candidates) tune_seq(, , length_out), tune_int(, , ) tune_choice(...): categorical choices tune_dep(depends_on, map): dependent mapping argument See vignettes end--end examples, spending function tuning, parallel + reproducible reporting.

what: gsDesignTune: Dependency-Aware Scenario Exploration for Group Sequential Designs — gsDesignTune-package
title: gsDesignTune: Dependency-Aware Scenario Exploration for Group Sequential Designs — gsDesignTune-package
text: Provides systematic, dependency-aware exploration group sequential designs created 'gsDesign'. Supports reproducible grid random search user-defined candidate sets, parallel evaluation via 'future' framework, standardized metric extraction, auditable reporting design-space evaluation trade-analysis. Methods group sequential design described Anderson (2025) doi:10.32614/CRAN.package.gsDesign . 'future' framework parallel processing described Bengtsson (2021) doi:10.32614/RJ-2021-048 .

title: gsDesignTune: Dependency-Aware Scenario Exploration for Group Sequential Designs — gsDesignTune-package
text: Maintainer: Nan Xiao @nanx.(ORCID)

title: gsDesignTune 0.1.0
text: gsDesignTune(), gsSurvTune(), gsSurvCalendarTune() create GSDTuneJob dependency-aware scenario exploration gsDesign::gsDesign() / gsDesign::gsSurv() / gsDesign::gsSurvCalendar() designs. Tune specifications tune_fixed(), tune_values(), tune_seq(), tune_int(), tune_choice(), tune_dep() grid/random search dependent parameters. Spending UX via SpendingSpec SpendingFamily tune spending function families parameter candidates. Parallel evaluation {future.apply} (user controls future::plan()) progress reporting via {progressr}. Standardized metric extraction (uses gsDesign::gsBoundSummary() available), plus ranking ($best()), Pareto filtering ($pareto()), plotting ($plot()), reporting ($report()). Reproducibility/audit features: stored job spec + sessionInfo(), per-configuration warnings/errors, call reconstruction via $call_args(); optional disk caching via cache_dir.
